alert.note: Alert for Howell (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 5:19PM CDT until March 31 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN SHANNON AND NORTHEASTERN HOWELL COUNTIES... At 518 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles northwest of Birch Tree, or 7 miles northeast of Mountain View, moving northeast at 95 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Echo Bluff State Park, Current River State Park, Ozark National Scenic Riverways, Mountain View, Eminence, Alley Spring, Teresita, Midridge, Round Spring, West Eminence and Pine Crest. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for south central Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This storm is producing damaging winds and large damaging hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
